report.title: Charles II, 1665
report.subtitle: Chapter VIII. An Act for avoiding unnecessary Suites and Delayes.[Rot. Parl. 17 C. II. nu. 9.]

section.head: In what Case Death after Verdi&bholigct; not to be alleged for Error.
section.para: For the avoiding of unnecessary Suites and Delayes Bee it ena&bholigct;ed by the Kings most Excellent Majestie by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spirituall and Temporall and Commons in this present Parlyament assembled and by Authoritie of the same That in all A&bholigct;ions Personall (1) Reall or mixt the death of either partie betweene the Verdi&bholigct; and the Judgement shall not hereafter be alleadged for Error soe as such Judgement be entred within Two Termes after such Verdi&bholigct;.

section.head: II. Proviso for Administrator de Bonis non suing Scire Facias.
section.para: And bee it further ena&bholigct;ed by the Authoritie aforesaid where any Judgement after a Verdi&bholigct; shall be had by or in the Name of any Executor or Administrator In such case an Administrator de bonis non may sue forth a Scire facias and take Execution upon such Judgement.

section.head: III. Continuance of A&bholigct;.
section.para: This A&bholigct; to continue for the space of Five yeares and from thence to the end of the next Session of Parlyament.
